oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Stress and failure analysis of 3D angle interlock woven composites
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: NAIK, NK
AZAD, SNM
PRASAD, PD
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: textile structural composites
carbon-carbon composites
incorporating solid rods
fabric composites
binary model
mechanisms
compression
behavior
delamination
toughness
3d composite
angle interlock woven
repeating unit cell
strength model
volume averaging
clastic properties
normal strength
shear strength
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A three-dimensional woven composite strength model is presented for predicting the failure behavior of three-dimensional angle interlock woven composites under on-axis uniaxial static tensile loading and shear loading. The model is based on two-level discretization of the repeating unit cell. The repeating unit cell is discretized into sections, elements, subsections and subelements. The model predicts the stress levels at which the secondary Failures take place at subelement level. The effect of secondary failure is considered for further analysis and the ultimate tensile strength and shear strength and the corresponding strains are predicted. A parametric study has been carried out For different 3D angle interlock woven composite configurations.
